pros: Very friendly welcoming environment. Very organized.
cons: Health and dental insurance are pricey for family package

job_title: Health Information Technician in Lawrence, MA
pros: Great work environment between normal staff, not higher ups.
cons: Horrible organization, they will complain all day about overflowing numbers but do nothing to address it. Higher ups are too scared to give advice to each other on how to run their department so they will let the horrible work flows get out of hand. The turn around time of this company is high so there is always a need for training and not even the right way. Ive heard of several employees being intimidated behind the scenes with PIP’s and write ups for things out of their control. Management constantly cried about how numbers are high and things are not getting done yet there was not enough staff to even work the large amount of patient influx. Management and higher ups also have a delusional expectation when it comes to workflow. 50 calls a day minimum for patient information to be able to bill things. I would not recommend this place to anyone

review_title: Great care for patients and families, training top notch!
job_title: RN Case Manager in Lowell, MA
pros: Great make your own schedule
cons: Short-staffed, travel minimal reimbursements offerred

job_title: Medical Records Technician in Lawrence, MA
pros:
Faxing and scanning...faxing and scanning...faxing and scanning
I had to go. 
The CEO was great! Motivated the team to want more for ourselves. She wanted more for our roles in medical records and so did I. Then after the motivational speech it was back to faxing and scanning. I thought I would be managing patient accounts and making sure all the patients information was complete in their electronic medical record. I was looking forward to working on patient portals but most of my time there it wasn't that at all. All I was doing was scanning millions of papers in patient records. When I wasn't doing that I was calling clinics to hunt down doctors to sign orders. 
Job was not for me.
cons: Faxing and scanning all day

pros: It’s been a good place to work.
cons: In a constant state of significant change.

pros: Great team work and great manager that work with you according to schedule
cons: On and off with patients, overall busy most days

pros:
Mission keeps patients and community first. Strong, experienced leadership all with strong background of evolving healthcare. Industry leadership as an organization with a strong focus on meeting the needs of patients and supporting a high quality staff to do that. Exceptional training of clinicians makes for an experienced team to work with. The organization is growing and managing that with a strategic vision and plan.

After 5 years, I left the organization for 18 months but returned. The organization's leadership, the quality of staff, and not-for-profit mission makes it a positive employment opportunity for clinical and non-clinical staff.
cons: Currently working to get more clinical staff to meet demands and help reduce sometimes heavy  schedule.

review_title: Not what I thought it would be.
pros:
Friendly coworkers (some not all) 
Was paid weekly 
Location
Vacation Time
cons:
Health Insurance
Management/Leadership out of touch with reality and expectations. You take so much but do not appreciate the staff. Layoffs, office closures. The merger was the worst decision and deal they made. 
Pay
No work life balance
Executives not in tuned with morale. Do something with feedback from staff who have left. 
Management needs to be in less closed door meetings about nothing and do more work. How do you get any work done if you are in meetings all day and don’t respond to emails or address staff concerns. 
HR was useless. They need someone more experienced to run that department.

pros: I have worked for Home Health VNA for the past 5 years. I have had the opportunity to advance my position within the organization due to support from the leadership team. Home Health VNA believes in their mission and cares about patients in the community. The organization works as a team to ensure the right care is provided at the right time. Home Health VNA strives for patient satisfaction and employee retention.  It is a good feeling to come to work everyday and enjoy the people you work with, feel supported by the management team and when you speak people listen.
cons: I have none to share, well maybe one. It seems everybody that works for the Home Health Foundation knows how to bake..It is really hard to stay on a diet.

pros: From initial interview, through the hiring process, to the first week of employment, it has been an easy and absolutely pleasurable experience. Everyone has been extremely helpful and welcoming. I am in awe at the level of skill and talent of the staff in all disciplines. I am very pleased to have become part of this extraordinary organization. Highly recommended!
cons: None to speak of at this time.

pros: It is a busy place to work which is great never a dull moment. People are willing to help each other out.
cons: Schedule not very flexible. People feel like some divisions are more important than others.
